page.title: 13 The Beck Row Churches
page.content: St.John's Church {photo} was built in 1875 and since 1980 has been the Parish Church.A Church Hall and Lychgate were added in 1908. 76 Airmen are buried in a special section of the graveyard. The congregation in 1985,which averages 30 people at each service,consists of both American and English families and the Sunday School for children is well supported.A resident Vicar has been recently appointed. The Methodist Chapel was built in 1829 but was burnt when struck by lightning in 1893 when the present building was erected.A hall was added in 1969 and is used by many organisations:W.I.;Women's Fellowship;Travelling Guild;Girl's Brigade;Sunday School;Bible Study Group;Dancing Academy and Keep Fit. On average, 20 people attend the services and 50 at Festivals. The Chapel is used by Beck Row School at Christmas.
